text: does that interfere with any interactive elements inside? (links) or even just images with alt text?
No it simply aids with screen readers to discern between tables for structure and tabular data.
I figured. just wanted to make sure it didn’t disable keyboard access to those cells if there was content inside
Not as far as I'm aware - it's been well tested by many well respected email developers (Litmus, Action Rocket, Rebel Mail)

Because it’s relevant thought I’d drop this here
I made an accessibility friendly FAQ module which does not impose styling - so you can make it visually look however you want, and know that it functions well for those with accessibility needs.
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/code-gallery/entry/founders/TheWebTech-HS-Accessible-FAQ-Module>

It’s open source so if you want to improve upon it feel free.

Also because these posts were related and I feel attention should be brought to them:
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C26E7JT8V/p1560266441037300?thread_ts=1560266441.037300>

this is very common as many users use any kind of autopopulate feature data on forms and many times some fields don't fit with what the form is asking and then the user needs to erase the field to see what the form is asking, too much time consuming for a form
